data.title: Overwrite Output Panel

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.5.2
- OS Version: Win10

Steps to Reproduce:

The Output panel (Ctrl+Shift+U) appends new information instead of overwriting it. It's hard to tell what's a new output and what's an old one. Please at least give an option to change this.

data.title: Debugging within vscode using Babel sourcemaps.
data.body:
- VSCode Version:1.5.3
- OS Version:Windows 8.1

I am trying to attach a debugger to the Jest testing environment in order to debug and test my react app. After some wrestling, I can start the Jest client via npm by running the command `node --debug-brk=5858 --harmony node_modules/jest/bin/jest.js --runInBand` through npm. I can also set breakpoints, but the issue is that I am using a babel transformer and instead of having my code brake at the original source, it breaks at the transpiled output which is not very intuitive. 

This is my launch configuration

`{
            "name" : "Attach via jest",
            "type": "node",
            "request": "attach",
            "sourceMaps" : true,
            "port": 5858,
            "timeout" : 5000

 }`

And within my .babelrc I have the following

`{
    "presets" : ["react-native"],
    "sourceMaps" : "inline"
}`

for inline source maps. Now I am not too familiar with how the inline source maps are supposed to work and even less if vscode supports them. So I would like to know if anyone could me with getting vscode to obtain the sourcemaps from babel and break at the correct points on the original source, rather than the transpiled output. Are there any other options I overlooked?

data.title: Mac OS: Allow to save files that need user elevation
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.5.3
- OS Version: macOS 10.12

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Install Code into command path using the Command pallet option **Shell command: Install 'code' command in PATH**
2. Open terminal then open a protected file using `code` Example: `$ code /etc/php.ini`
3. Edit file then `cmd + S` to save
4. VSCode responds with `Error Failed to save 'php.ini': File is write protected.  Select 'Overwrite' to remove protection.`
- Clicking **Overwrite** produces the same message
- Clicking **Cancel** produces the same message
- Clicking Esc key or **Discard** dismisses the message

Typical behavior would be to prompt the user for administrator credentials to allow the protected file to be saved.

data.title: [BUG] The vscode can't correctly parse definition!
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.5.3
- OS Version: Ubuntu 16.04.1 LTS

I was using `bluebird` and `fs` to do something but the `promise.map` shows incorrect type.

Demo:

```
    let readdir = Promise.promisify(fs.readdir);
    let templatesDir = `${__dirname}/templates`;
    readdir(templatesDir).map(filename => filename)
```

The map shows type is `(method) Bluebird<string[]>.map<{}, {}>(mapper: (item: {}, index: number, arrayLength: number) => {} | Promise.Thenable<{}>, options?: Promise.ConcurrencyOption): Promise<{}[]>`.

Ideally, it should show `Bluebird<string[]>.map<string, string>`. Why is it `Bluebird<string[]>.map<{}, {}>`?

I used `sublime` is okay but `vscode` not. What happened?

data.title: No way to interact with definition hover preview

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
Since @joaomoreno's work in [#2330](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/2330#issuecomment-245214728), hovers use a widget with scrollable cells and it works very nicely for type info, docs, etc.

Definition previews for a symbol (shown when holding ⌘ on hover) can also show up in the hover widget in a scrollable cell. But in this case it seems impossible to interact with the scrollable definition preview content because the hover disappears as soon as you mouse over it if you are holding ⌘.

Is there a way to fix this?

data.title: Missing rule for not inserting spaces after/before braces
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.5.3
- OS Version: macOS Sierra

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Add `"javascript.format.insertSpaceAfterOpeningAndBeforeClosingNonemptyBrackets": false` to the workspace settings
2. Type `const a = {b: 1};`
3. Format Code
4. Code is now formatted `const a = { b: 1 };`

I guess this is similar to https://github.com/Microsoft/TypeScript/issues/7540 and this rule considers only `[` and `]` as _brackets_ and actually a new rule `javascript.format.insertSpaceAfterOpeningAndBeforeClosingNonemptyBraces` should be added to support _braces_: `{` and `}`

data.title: Sort the installed extension list
data.body: According to #12910. This PR will sort the installed extensions by its name in ascending order.

data.title: Shorten file path of files with same name
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.5.3
- OS Version: Windows 10

Hi,

Steps to Reproduce:
1. For example I have 2 files with same name but in different folders:
   - C:\Users\a\foo\test\a.txt
   - C:\Users\a\bar\test\a.txt
2. Open them.
3. ![vsc](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/21136418/19220673/12d3c35a-8e5d-11e6-9fa4-6a7f66b22b7e.png)

So I have 2 suggestions:
1. Would you please add option to shorten file paths so that they will be shown like this?
   - foo\test
   - bar\test
2. Would you add option to shorten file path if it's too long, like 300 pixels? For example, you can use the ellipsize character `…`.

It would help a lot, since my project is located in a deep sub folder. Showing full paths will take a lot of space.

Thank you,

data.title: An extra underline in js auto-complete
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.5.3
- OS Version: win 10

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Create a new js file
2. Input "abc.__def" in first line
3. Input "__" (2 underlines) in the second line, the first one in auto-complete list will be "___def" (3 underlines)

data.title: VSCode icon will disappear from dock once restart the mac
data.body: - VSCode Version: Insider 1.6.0 (2016-10-07T18:57:32.707Z) & Stable 1.5.3 - OS Version: 10.12 Steps to Reproduce: 1. Drag any version of vscode into docker. 2. Restart. 3. You will see the app icon becomes a question mark, and also you cannot open the app through clicking those icons. Also the insiders version icon remains, but it is not functional!!

data.title: reimplement spread operator for node 4
data.body:
This reimplements the spread operator for node 4.  As of now node 4
is the stable LTS release, and so it is the version which is supplied
on many distributions.  This change reimplements the gulpfile to not
use spread operator to make vscode working on systems using node 4.

data.title: Keyboard short for duplicating selection
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.5.3
- OS Version: Windows 10

It would be nice to have a keyboard shortcut for duplicating selection, which is equal to ctrl+c, ctrl+v. It's equivalant in sublime is ctrl+shift+d. There is a copyLineDown right now which are nice but doesn't copy the selection, just entire line.

There's also another issue that tracks a bunch of shortcuts, including this one but only for mac. There's a plugin for the duplication as well but it seems to be a visual studio plugin. I guess there must be a way to have those run for vs code but I didn't look it up.

data.title: Add an option to turn brackets matching on or off

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.5.3 (5be4091987a98e3870d89d630eb87be6d9bafd27, 2016-09-22T08:50:42.185Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 6.1.7601

I would like to have an option in preferences file to turn bracket matching on or off.

Sometimes, when typing it is hard to detect where the caret is. For example:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7231941/19213322/f08dedac-8d71-11e6-8d55-8626ce23ff06.png)

In this case it is better to hide bracket markers altogether.

When I need to locate a matching brace I could use key-bound command "Go to bracket".

data.title: Reversal of scrolling is ignored
data.body:
- VSCode Version:1.5.3
- OS Version: Debian 8 (XFCE)

Steps to Reproduce:
1. In mouse setting set trackpad to use reverse scrolling [1]
2. observe that scrolling is not reversed as it is in Chrome, other editors (vim/gvim, sublime text) and basically all other system applications

[1] ![screenshot](https://i.imgur.com/qhqu88B.png)
